intro: Sibthorpia retusa f. grandifolia, commonly known as the large-flowered sibthorpia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a smooth texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or forested areas.
